snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin blocked the import of some food and agricultural products for a year, an attempt to hit back at Western sanctions without punishing Russian consumers.
abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin gives his government broad mandate to issue one-year bans on food and agricultural imports, retaliation for Western sanctions over events in Ukraine; includes proviso that bans be lifted if they drive up prices or cause undue dependence on a single source; decree does not name specific products or countries to be banned.

byline.original: By ANDREW E. KRAMER and NEIL MacFARQUHAR
byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer reported from Donetsk, and Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin blocked the import of some food and agricultural products for a year, an attempt to hit back at Western sanctions without punishing Russian consumers.

headline.main: Putin Bans Some Imports as Payback for Sanctions
headline.print_headline: Putin Bans Some Imports as Payback for Sanctions
